results.title: Man in flight
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Hamilton Luske
results.brief_description: A Walt Disney animated production tracing the development of aviation and the men responsible. From Leonardo da Vinci’s earliest ideas in flight, the film documents the early pioneers’ attempts at manned flight such as France’s Mont Brothers and the United States’ George Cayley and the Wright Brothers. Explains the rapid development of aviation up to the present jet age. Edited by Lloyd Richardson, sound by Robert O’Cook, music by Oliver Wallace.

results.title: Man in Ethiopia
results.creator_credit: Allegro Film Productions and ETO Films
results.brief_description: Shows the interwoven cultures of primitive and modern people in Ethiopia and seeks to relate the importance of tradition in the Judeo-Christian religion which these African people so zealously follow.

results.title: Man hunt
results.creator_credit: Video Arts, Reed Executive Selection and Peter Robinson
results.brief_description: Outlines how to conduct effective staff selection interviews. John Cleese portrays the managers, Ethel the Unready, Ivan the Terrible and William the Silent who show the common mistakes of lack of preparation, failure to encourage the candidate to talk openly and relevantly and failing to introduce direct and probing questions. Norman Bowler demonstrates the correct interview techniques.

results.title: Man for the job
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Gregory Clegg and Margaret Smith
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Personnel Management”.
Explains job analysis and techniques of ability testing, illustrated by two case studies of applications from the personnel manager’s point of view.

results.title: Man feeding his dogs: oil by Russell Drysdale
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and David Muir
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “The Australian eye III”.
A small but powerful painting by Russell Drysdale, which combines starkness with lyricism. The artist talks about his reactions to the picture and his problems in painting it, and his style and technique of underpainting and glazing.

results.title: Man belongs to the earth
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Roman Kroitor and Graeme Ferguson
results.brief_description: Deals with the natural environment of United States cities, the desert, the oceans, and the mountains. Shows the dead waste and destruction threatening the environment, and the natural wonders that should be preserved. Presents the problems and some solutions.

results.title: Man and woman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Themes of Literature”.
This film, edited from Zeffirelli’s lusty version of Shakespeare’s “Taming of the Shrew”, unfurls with great fun a Renaissance version of the spectacle known as ‘the battle of the sexes’. Stars Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor. As the commentator points out the dramatising violent conflict between men and women in search of love is one way that world literature has dealt with the relationship between the sexes.
